sentences.en: A sagacious businessman seldom fails in his business.
sentences.cn: 精明的商人在生意上很少失败.

sentences.en: Having dismissed the sagacious Partridge, Mr. Jones sat himself down to write.
sentences.cn: 琼斯先生把精明的巴特里奇打发走之后, 就坐下来写信.

sentences.en: He is the most sagacious member of the committee.
sentences.cn: 他是委员会里最富洞察力的成员.

sentences.en: He thought me much more sagacious than I was.
sentences.cn: 他把我看得太高明了,而我实际上并不是这样.

sentences.en: My procedure seemed as sagacious as ever but only in theory.
sentences.cn: 我的做法似乎仍像以前一样高超精明--但那只是从理论上讲.

sentences.en: No more sagacious agent could, I suppose, be desired.
sentences.cn: 我想, 所能想望的, 也不会有更精明强干的代理人了.

sentences.en: Observant and thoughtful, he was given to asking sagacious questions.
sentences.cn: 敏锐而深思, 他喜欢问那些明智高深的问题.

sentences.en: People love dogs because they are sagacious animals.
sentences.cn: 人们爱狗,因为它们是有灵性的动物.

sentences.en: The cat was a remarkably beautiful animal , entirely black and sagacious to an astonishing degree.
sentences.cn: 这只猫很漂亮, 全身乌黑,并且惊人地聪明.

sentences.en: The leader made a sagacious decision.
The Prince Prospero was happy and dauntless and sagacious.
sentences.cn: 普罗斯珀罗亲王是个无忧无虑、无所畏惧、聪敏睿智的人.

sentences.en: The sagacious minister offered what he considered a rather clever explanation.
sentences.cn: 道貌岸然的牧师说了一套他认为相当聪明的解释.

sentences.en: They are mighty sagacious, tractable creature.
sentences.cn: 它们都是十分伶俐, 十分容易驾驭的动物.

sentences.en: They stood throwing each other sentences all sprightful and sagacious for a while.
sentences.cn: 他们站着,兴致勃勃,风趣横生地交谈了一会儿.

words.tran_cn: 睿智的，聪慧的；有远见的，聪慧的

trans.tran_cn: 精明的，有判断力的，明智，睿哲，哲
trans.tran_en: able to understand and judge things very well
